key_themes: January seasonal strength and tech momentum
Rate policy uncertainty and Fed guidance
Institutional de-risking vs retail optimism divergence
risk_factors: 218% market cap-to-GDP ratio signaling valuation extremes
Earnings disappointments in fintech and software creating contagion risk
European regulatory tightening causing capital flight
Divergence between retail bullishness and institutional cash raising (Buffett positioning)
Year-end options expiration mechanics creating tactical volatility
analysis.intraday_levels: SPY testing Call Wall resistance at $700 with active dealer hedging creating drag. QQQ pinned near Max Pain $620 with immediate Call Wall resistance. Watch $680 SPY support (60k OI) for active hedging support if pullback occurs.
analysis.swing_levels: SPY: Upside capped near $700 Call Wall initially, then $730 (48k OI) if breakthrough occurs. Downside support dormant until $640 (100k OI), then major Put Wall $630 (143k OI). QQQ: Immediate resistance $620-$630 zone, upside target $640 (31k OI). Support activates $590 (78k OI), major floor $574.78 Put Wall (122k OI).
